intro: Dianthus multipunctatus, commonly known as the spotted campion, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is characterized by its clusters of pink or white, five-petaled flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with slender, branching stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are often adorned with small, dark spots, giving it its common name. Dianthus multipunctatus is often found in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to Mediterranean climates.
